author: Staff Reporter
text:
The NDA government at the Centre, headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, had released Rs. 274.48 crore for developing 32 Tier II and III cities in Tamil Nadu under Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT), said M. Venkaiah Naidu, Union Minister of Urban Development, Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation and Parliamentary Affairs, here on Wednesday.

Addressing a meeting organised by the BJP near Anna Stadium here, Mr. Naidu said that the Centre had planned AMRUT scheme with an outlay of Rs. 3,242.03 crore for developing small cities with a population of below one lakh, in association with the Tamil Nadu government. The State’s share under this programme was Rs. 1,372 crore.

Under the Union government’s plan to develop 100 cities under Smart Cities scheme, eight big cities, including Chennai, had been selected for which, the Centre had sanctioned Rs. 1,652 crore. The Centre had planned to allocate Rs. 1,007 crore for development works in Nagercoil alone.

Union Minister of State for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon. Radhakrishnan criticised the State government for not laying roads in Kanyakumari despite the Centre sanctioning funds for the purpose.
title: “NDA govt. released Rs. 274 cr. for developing Tier II, III cities in TN”
